messages.title: NHS Funding: Lib Dems only party to make commitment
messages.content: Alasdair Murray and the Liberal Democrats are the only main party to commit the extra £8 billion a year the NHS needs to maintain good quality services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Commitment to an extra £8 billion a year for the NHS to maintain good quality services and deal with aging population and mental health services.

issues.health: Commitment to an extra £8 billion a year for the NHS to maintain good quality services and deal with aging population and mental health services.

leaflet.personalStatement: Alasdair lives in the heart of the Oxford East constituency with his wife - a director of a patient information forum - and has two children. He was educated at Oxford University and has worked as an economic journalist on a national newspaper and as a trustee for two national charities.

quotes.text: Without extra real-terms investment our NHS simply won't be able to keep up with growing demand.

images.caption: Alasdair Murray and the team - A strong voice for Oxford East

leaflet.additionalNotes: Murray pledges a dedication to NHS improvement including mental health services incorrectly neglected by previous governments. Opposes Labour and Tories for not committing to NHS funding increase. Highlights public support for fully funded NHS. States neither Labour nor the Conservatives have so far committed to the necessary NHS funding increase.
